code: import React from"react";import"./About.style.css";import ReactPlayer from"react-player";import{jsx as _jsx}from"react/jsx-runtime";import{jsxs as _jsxs}from"react/jsx-runtime";var About=function About(){return/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("div",{children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("div",{class:"aboutcontainer",children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("h2",{children:"So what's the deal with the Nyquist Shannon Theorem?"}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("ul",{children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("li",{children:"The Nyquist-Shannon Theorem states that when representing an analog signal digitally, as long as your number of sampling points is at least twice as great as the signal\u2019s highest frequency, you can represent that signal using only those points without losing any information at all."}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("li",{children:"This means if we resample an audio file to have a sampling rate that is twice it's maximum detected frequency, we can greatly reduce the file size."}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("li",{children:"Our visualizer accepts a large audio file and reduces the amount of points without any audio loss or drop in quality."})]})]}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("div",{class:"aboutvideo",children:/*#__PURE__*/_jsx(ReactPlayer,{url:"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FcXZ28BX-xE&t=330s&ab_channel=SteveBrunton"})})]});};export default About;
